conclusion: Analyze the forces and motion of the rods in the magnetic field.
Gravitational force component acting down the incline on rod a is m_a g sin theta.
Calculate gravitational force on rod a: F_gravity, a = 1.5 N.
Magnetic force on rod a due to current I is B I L.
Net force on rod a is F_net, a = F - m_a g sin theta - B I L.
Gravitational force component acting down the incline on rod b is m_b g sin theta.
Calculate gravitational force on rod b: F_gravity, b = 0.5 N.
Magnetic force on rod b is also B I L.
Net force on rod b is F_net, b = B I L - m_b g sin theta.
Current I is induced due to motion of rods in magnetic field.
Induced emf is given by: E = B L (v_a + v_b).
Total resistance is R_total = 2R.
Calculate total resistance: R_total = 0.2 Ohm.
Current I is: I = E / R_total = B L (v_a + v_b) / 0.2.
Work done by force F is converted into kinetic energy and heat.
Energy equation: W = F x = Q_a + 0.5 m_a v_a^2 + 0.5 m_b v_b^2.
Given Q_a = 0.12 J and v_a = 1.0 m/s.
Work done by force F: W = 2x.
Energy equation: 2x = 0.12 + 0.15 + 0.05 v_b^2.
Solve for x: 2x = 0.27 + 0.05 v_b^2.
Relate x to v_a: x = v_a^2 / 2a = 1^2 / 2a.
